intro: Cormonema multiflorum, commonly known as the clustered corymbiferous plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its underground corm-like structures that serve as storage organs for nutrients. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring season. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
